definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: Enlightenment, it seems, always comes from an earnest study of the Word of God.
sentences.chinese: 啓迪似乎總是從懇切地研究上帝的道而來。

sentences.english: Usually they are calm and sincere.
sentences.chinese: 他們通常心如止水，誠摯懇切。

sentences.english: We plead for lifestyle changes and strict tobacco regulation.
sentences.chinese: 我們懇切希望改變生活方式並嚴格管制菸草。

sentences.english: Mr. Darcy spoke with affectionate praise of his sister's proficiency.
sentences.chinese: 達西先生極其懇切地把自己妹妹的成就讚揚了一番。

sentences.english: Kong Yiji waited for a while, then said earnestly: “You can’t, can you?
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己等了許久，很懇切的說道，“不能寫罷？

sentences.english: Is there some earnest prayer unanswered yet
sentences.chinese: 有些懇切的祈禱，有否迴音？

sentences.english: Dena looked appealingly at Blair, hoping to hear a contrary opinion.
sentences.chinese: 德娜懇切地看着布萊爾，希望聽到相反的觀點。

sentences.english: He spoke with a pleading earnestness, taking alan by the breast of the coat.
sentences.chinese: 他懇求似地抓住了艾倫的外套的前襟，說得那麼懇切。

sentences.english: He addresses the viewer directly, imploringly, with a rose in hand.
sentences.chinese: 他手持玫瑰，面向觀者，懇切哀求。

sentences.english: Pray earnestly for each student by name.
sentences.chinese: 爲每一個學生懇切地提名禱告。

sentences.english: He earnestly appealed to his friends for support.
sentences.chinese: 他懇切地向朋友請求支持。

sentences.english: She gave him a sincere explanation.
Maybe imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.
sentences.chinese: 可能模仿是奉承的最懇切的形式。

sentences.english: Indeed I will, ' said the boy, earnestly.
sentences.chinese: 我確實將會這樣去做的，”孩子懇切地說道。

sentences.english: His victory is an evidence of the power of importunate prayer.
sentences.chinese: 他的勝利說明了懇切祈禱的力量。

sentences.english: He really pressed them, with some earnestness , to consider Norland as their home;
sentences.chinese: 他頗爲懇切地請求她們把諾蘭莊園當作自己的家。

definition: in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
meaningful and heartfelt words (idiom); sincere and earnest wishes
to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
